<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HOUSING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/24/2020-residential-real-estate-sales-soar-mortgage-delinquencies?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
2020’s Housing Market: Location, Location, and Lockdown Orders
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Housing inventory is low" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNTE1L2hvdXNpbmdfaW52ZW50b3J5X2lzX2xvdy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Covid era has been even better for the housing market than it’s been for Peloton instructors' Instagram followings.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>When quarantines forced us to jury-rig encyclopedia standing desks, we had to spend more quality time with the weird beige paint in the living room...and started shopping for new homes. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/08/06/success/mortgage-rates-record-low-august/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Record-low</a></span><span> mortgage rates, spurred by the Fed's moves to lower borrowing costs across the economy, have also helped strike up demand for housing. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">New data out this week showed the housing market stayed strong throughout the summer. In August, U.S. new-home sales <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-09-24/u-s-new-home-sales-climb-to-1-million-rate-fastest-since-2006?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">increased</a> at the fastest rate since 2006, the government reported yesterday, marking four straight months of growth. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Only problem? We’re running out of homes to sell </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At the current pace of sales, it would only take 3.3 months to run out of inventory. The supply/demand mismatch is <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/americans-want-homes-but-there-have-rarely-been-fewer-for-sale-11600680612?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pushing prices</a> skyward, especially since sellers aren’t exactly rushing to host open houses these days. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The supply squeeze has bolstered the home construction industry in a big way. Single-family housing starts for August reached the highest annual rate since February. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Actually, there’s one more (major) problem </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With the economy still in the basement, people <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/the-covid-19-lockdown-is-squeezing-real-estate-from-all-sides-and-threatens-to-burst-the-housing-and-mortgage-bubble-2020-09-21?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">are straining</a> to pay their mortgages. According to industry analyst Keith Jurow, “several million” people will have gone nine months without making a payment when the Federal Housing Finance Agency's foreclosure and eviction moratorium expires at the end of the year. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>17% of FHA-insured mortgages were delinquent in July, per the Department of Housing and Urban Development. In NYC, 27.2% of mortgages were. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>The housing market is one of the few sectors to experience a true V-shaped recovery following the initial hit from the pandemic. But without enough houses for sale, the newfound demand is driving what some experts are calling an <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/09/24/coronavirus-pandemic-fuels-affordability-crisis-for-homebuyers.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">affordability crisis</a>, in which higher home prices strip away the benefit from lower interest rates. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/24/epic-games-spotify-form-coalition-fight-apple-google?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Epic Games Squads Up Against Apple
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Epic Games video attacking Apple" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNTA3L2VwaWNfZ2FtZXNfdmlkZW9fYXR0YWNraW5nX2FwcGxlLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Epic Games</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, <em>Fortnite </em>maker Epic Games, Tinder owner Match Group, and <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-09-24/spotify-wants-to-turn-its-podcasts-into-tv-shows-and-movies?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">filmmaker Spotify</a> teamed up with 10 other companies to launch the Coalition for App Fairness, a nonprofit that will advocate for <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/fortnite-maker-spotify-form-advocacy-group-to-push-for-app-store-changes-11600945246?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">legal and regulatory changes</a> to app stores.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Target #1: Apple</strong>. The company’s <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/22/antitrust-spotlight-app-store-hurt-developers-overcharge-consumers?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">controversial App Store fees</a> are at the center of a legal fight Epic launched this summer. Epic added in-app payments to the <em>Fortnite</em> app that sidestepped Apple's customary 30% cut, which prompted Apple (and later Google) to kick <em>Fortnite </em>off its store. Epic sued, Apple countersued, and now the app proletariat are organizing a revolution against the Big Tech Bourgeoise.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">They’ve got demands</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://appfairness.org/our-vision/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Ten, to be exact</a><strong style="color:#000">. </strong>The coalition argues Apple and other app marketplaces exploit developers with high commissions, stifle competition, and prioritize their own products and services.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In an unofficial response, Apple updated its website yesterday to reiterate how its platform benefits developers and users. The company said 28 million people globally use its developer program. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>this Team Rumble is going down in the courts. The next hearing for Apple’s countersuit against Epic is Monday.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
VENTURE CAPITAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/24/spotify-founder-pledges-12b-european-startups?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Name That Swede
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="SUN VALLEY, ID - JULY 11: Daniel Ek, co-founder and chief executive offi..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNTE0L2FubnVhbF9hbGxlbl9hbmRfY29fbWVldC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Drew Angerer/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Hint: He founded Europe’s most valuable tech company.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Daniel Ek, the 37-year-old founder and top dog at Spotify, <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2020/09/24/spotify-ceo-daniel-ek-pledges-1bn-of-his-wealth-to-back-deeptech-startups-from-europe/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">promised to invest</a> roughly a third of his personal wealth (1 billion euros, or $1.2 billion) into European tech startups yesterday, with a focus on “moonshot projects” in machine learning, biotech, and materials science. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Tired of the 17-hour flight from Stockholm to San Francisco Intl., Ek wants to create a European counterweight to Silicon Valley. “Some of the most promising tech talent in Europe leaves because they don’t feel valued here,” he said at the Slush tech conference. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Why is Europe behind?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When your continent’s most recognizable tech exports are Spotify, Skype, and the guillotine, it means you’re playing catchup to Big Tech powerhouses in the U.S. and China. In Sweden, Spotify’s birthplace, just three startups have reached unicorn status (>$1 billion valuation), per CB Insights: Klarna, Northvolt, and Oatly. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In August, U.S. tech stocks </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/28/us-tech-stocks-are-now-worth-more-than-the-entire-european-stock-market.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reached</a></span><span> a market cap greater than all European stocks </span><span><em>combined</em></span><span>. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Some argue Europe’s stronger regulations and a lack of funding are responsible for the disparity. Ek’s trying to tackle that last one.</p>

<img alt="Amazon Ring" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNTE2L2FtYXpvbl9yaW5nLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Ring</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Amazon’s slowly chipping away at its goal of connecting every device in your home to the internet, from the toilet seat to the rice cooker. Yesterday afternoon, the company <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/09/24/amazon-hardware-event-live-updates.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">showed off</a> new gadgets and services, including...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Upgraded Echo devices with a fresh, spherical design</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>An in-car security system from Ring (Amazon’s home security unit), available first for Tesla drivers</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Luna, a </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/10/cloud-gaming-big-tech-streaming-wars?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cloud gaming service</a></span><span> to compete against Microsoft's xCloud and Google Stadia </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">But the craziest part...</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A $250 home security camera that lives on a fully autonomous drone. The <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/9/24/21453709/ring-always-home-cam-indoor-drone-security-camera-price-specs-features-amazon?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Always Home Cam</a> can show users any room inside their house (you get to pick where it’s allowed to fly). </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Amazon covered the propellers to prevent damage and added obstacle avoidance technology...but we’ll see how well those work when the toddler and house cat team up. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Amazon said its new devices will get the “climate pledge friendly” stamp of approval. The company emphasized ways it's reducing its environmental impact, from low-power mode to using recycled materials.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To read more about Amazon's master strategy, sign up for <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=inline&utm_campaign=link&email={email}" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Emerging Tech Brew</a>, which will hit your inbox later today.</p>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nHOUSING \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/24/2020-residential-real-estate-sales-soar-mortgage-delinquencies?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\n2020’s Housing Market: Location, Location, and Lockdown Orders\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Housing inventory is low\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNTE1L2hvdXNpbmdfaW52ZW50b3J5X2lzX2xvdy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Covid era has been even better for the housing market than it’s been for Peloton instructors' Instagram followings.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWhen quarantines forced us to jury-rig encyclopedia standing desks, we had to spend more quality time with the weird beige paint in the living room...and started shopping for new homes. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/08/06/success/mortgage-rates-record-low-august/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eRecord-low\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e mortgage rates, spurred by the Fed's moves to lower borrowing costs across the economy, have also helped strike up demand for housing. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNew data out this week showed the housing market stayed strong throughout the summer. In August, U.S. new-home sales \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-09-24/u-s-new-home-sales-climb-to-1-million-rate-fastest-since-2006?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eincreased\u003c/a\u003e at the fastest rate since 2006, the government reported yesterday, marking four straight months of growth. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eOnly problem? We’re running out of homes to sell \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAt the current pace of sales, it would only take 3.3 months to run out of inventory. The supply/demand mismatch is \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/americans-want-homes-but-there-have-rarely-been-fewer-for-sale-11600680612?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epushing prices\u003c/a\u003e skyward, especially since sellers aren’t exactly rushing to host open houses these days. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe supply squeeze has bolstered the home construction industry in a big way. Single-family housing starts for August reached the highest annual rate since February. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eActually, there’s one more (major) problem \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith the economy still in the basement, people \u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/the-covid-19-lockdown-is-squeezing-real-estate-from-all-sides-and-threatens-to-burst-the-housing-and-mortgage-bubble-2020-09-21?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eare straining\u003c/a\u003e to pay their mortgages. According to industry analyst Keith Jurow, “several million” people will have gone nine months without making a payment when the Federal Housing Finance Agency's foreclosure and eviction moratorium expires at the end of the year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e17% of FHA-insured mortgages were delinquent in July, per the Department of Housing and Urban Development. In NYC, 27.2% of mortgages were. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThe housing market is one of the few sectors to experience a true V-shaped recovery following the initial hit from the pandemic. But without enough houses for sale, the newfound demand is driving what some experts are calling an \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/09/24/coronavirus-pandemic-fuels-affordability-crisis-for-homebuyers.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eaffordability crisis\u003c/a\u003e, in which higher home prices strip away the benefit from lower interest rates. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eEpic Games\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, \u003cem\u003eFortnite \u003c/em\u003emaker Epic Games, Tinder owner Match Group, and \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-09-24/spotify-wants-to-turn-its-podcasts-into-tv-shows-and-movies?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efilmmaker Spotify\u003c/a\u003e teamed up with 10 other companies to launch the Coalition for App Fairness, a nonprofit that will advocate for \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/fortnite-maker-spotify-form-advocacy-group-to-push-for-app-store-changes-11600945246?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elegal and regulatory changes\u003c/a\u003e to app stores.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTarget #1: Apple\u003c/strong\u003e. The company’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/22/antitrust-spotlight-app-store-hurt-developers-overcharge-consumers?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econtroversial App Store fees\u003c/a\u003e are at the center of a legal fight Epic launched this summer. Epic added in-app payments to the \u003cem\u003eFortnite\u003c/em\u003e app that sidestepped Apple's customary 30% cut, which prompted Apple (and later Google) to kick \u003cem\u003eFortnite \u003c/em\u003eoff its store. Epic sued, Apple countersued, and now the app proletariat are organizing a revolution against the Big Tech Bourgeoise.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThey’ve got demands\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://appfairness.org/our-vision/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eTen, to be exact\u003c/a\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e. \u003c/strong\u003eThe coalition argues Apple and other app marketplaces exploit developers with high commissions, stifle competition, and prioritize their own products and services.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn an unofficial response, Apple updated its website yesterday to reiterate how its platform benefits developers and users. The company said 28 million people globally use its developer program. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethis Team Rumble is going down in the courts. The next hearing for Apple’s countersuit against Epic is Monday.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2020/09/24/spotify-ceo-daniel-ek-pledges-1bn-of-his-wealth-to-back-deeptech-startups-from-europe/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTired of the 17-hour flight from Stockholm to San Francisco Intl., Ek wants to create a European counterweight to Silicon Valley. “Some style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhen your continent’s most recognizable tech exports are Spotify, Skype, and the guillotine, it means you’re playing catchup to Big Tech powerhouses in the U.S. and China. In Sweden, Spotify’s birthplace, just three startups have reached unicorn status (\u003e$1 billion valuation), per CB Insights: Klarna, Northvolt, and Oatly. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn August, U.S. tech stocks \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/28/us-tech-stocks-are-now-worth-more-than-the-entire-european-stock-market.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereached\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e a market cap greater than all European stocks \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003ecombined\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eSome argue Europe’s stronger regulations and a lack of funding are responsible for the disparity.
